title: Multimodal Feature Integration for RGB-D Scene Recognition and Scientific Inquiry Education

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the field, along with understanding of the scientific methodology (hypothesis formulation–experimentation–analysis–conclusion)
context.additional_context: Cultivating technology integration skills linked to science curricula for pre-service teachers, with a focus on strengthening experimental design and data analysis competencies in physics and engineering fields

learning_goals: Explain and visualize the principles of multimodal feature extraction from RGB-D data using scientific inquiry methods.
Implement a scene recognition model utilizing hierarchical feature integration structures and systematically analyze experimental variables.

Learners can propose at least three optimized data processing strategies to operate an object recognition model with over 85% accuracy using smartphone RGB-D sensor data in a constrained technical environment (1GB RAM, ARM processor) within one week. They must create a performance comparison table for each strategy and derive evidence-based conclusions.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
